attributes.action: Regulate MPs speech time so that bills can be voted and not boycotted!!
attributes.additional_details:
Two recent examples of how this boycott is used to get nothing done by disrespectful MPs in Parliament:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/tory-mp-philip-davies-speaks-for-90-minutes-to-stop-carers-getting-free-hospital-parking-a6715641.html

And

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/tory-mps-block-bill-to-give-first-aid-training-to-children-by-talking-until-time-runs-out-a6742251.html

By not stopping this abuse, all parliamentary members are subsequently incompetents.
attributes.background:
Boycott is being used by MPs to waste public money,  parliamentary time, and to bully others not to vote.

If an MP is unable to deliver a comprehensive speech in time it means he is an incompetent MP  unable to express the very basis of his own post: speaking on behalf of his constituency.
